bgu.spl.a2

Class Promise<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bgu.spl.a2.Promise<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the result type, resolved - initialized ;

    public class Promise<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    this class represents a deferred result i.e., an object that eventually will be resolved to hold a result of some operation, the class allows for getting the result once it is available and registering a callback that will be called once the result is available. Note for implementors: you may add methods and synchronize any of the existing methods in this class *BUT* you must be able to explain why the synchronization is needed. In addition, the methods you add can only be private, protected or package protected - in other words, no new public methods

      Constructor and Description
      Promise() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T get() 
      boolean isResolved() 
      void resolve(T value)
      resolve this promise object - from now on, any call to the method get() should return the given value Any callbacks that were registered to be notified when this object is resolved via the subscribe(callback) method should be executed before this method returns
      void subscribe(callback callback)
      add a callback to be called when this object is resolved.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public T get()
        Returns:
        the resolved value if such exists (i.e., if this object has been resolve(java.lang.Object)ed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - in the case where this method is called and this object is not yet resolved

      • isResolved

        public boolean isResolved()
        Returns:
        true if this object has been resolved - i.e., if the method resolve(java.lang.Object) has been called on this object before.

      • resolve

        public void resolve(T value)
        resolve this promise object - from now on, any call to the method get() should return the given value Any callbacks that were registered to be notified when this object is resolved via the subscribe(callback) method should be executed before this method returns
        Parameters:
        value - - the value to resolve this promise object with
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - in the case where this object is already resolved

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(callback callback)
        add a callback to be called when this object is resolved. If while calling this method the object is already resolved - the callback should be called immediately Note that in any case, the given callback should never get called more than once, in addition, in order to avoid memory leaks - once the callback got called, this object should not hold its reference any longer.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be called when the promise object is resolved
